docs.snippet: LEAD: CONGRESS is considering legislation that would restrict trade with countries that do not respect certain ''internationally recognized workers' rights,'' such as the right to bargain collectively, a minimum wage, occupational safety and health...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: CONGRESS is considering legislation that would restrict trade with countries that do not respect certain ''internationally recognized workers' rights,'' such as the right to bargain collectively, a minimum wage, occupational safety and health standards and others. In this misguided approach, countries that do not live up to the standards we set for them could face tariffs, quotas or the loss of special trading privileges.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay have urged the countries attending the summit meeting in Venice to consider the problem of international debt. As debtors - sometimes defaulting debtors - their request may seem self-serving. As leaders in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay have urged the countries attending the summit meeting in Venice to consider the problem of international debt. As debtors - sometimes defaulting debtors - their request may seem self-serving. As leaders in the struggle to consolidate new democracies, they are making a request that we ignore only at risk to our prosperity, security and commitment to democracy.

headline.main: Uruguayan Clears Up 'State of Siege' Killing

byline.original: By SHIRLEY CHRISTIAN, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: MARTIN RAMIREZ IS AN UN-likely artistic icon. A poor Mexican who drifted across the border around the time of the Mexican Revolution, he did odd jobs for a while before gradually lapsing into what was diagnosed as a form of paranoid...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MARTIN RAMIREZ IS AN UN-likely artistic icon. A poor Mexican who drifted across the border around the time of the Mexican Revolution, he did odd jobs for a while before gradually lapsing into what was diagnosed as a form of paranoid schizophrenia. He suffered from delusions and hallucinations, stopped speaking and spent the last 30 years of his life in a mental institution until his death in 1960.

headline.main: THE VARIED PALETTE OF HISPANIC ART IN AMERICA
